# Introduction

## Q&A

- What is a Gaussian process?
  - *A Gaussian process can be thought of as an extension of the multivariate normal distribution to an infinite number of random variables covering each point on the input domain*
  - *A Gaussian process is a probabilistic method that gives a confidence for a function representing a set of points*
  - *For a given set of training points, there are potentially infinitely many functions that fit the data. Gaussian processes offer an elegant solution to this problem by assigning a probability to each of these functions*
  - *The key idea of Gaussian processes is to model the underlying distribution of XX together with YY as a multivariate normal distribution*
- What is a kernel?
  - *The covariance between function values at any two points*

helpful visualizations [^1] [^2]

[^1]: https://distill.pub/2019/visual-exploration-gaussian-processes/
[^2]: http://www.infinitecuriosity.org/vizgp/
